channel.title: Setting up a tile-based map?
channel.description:
Using Java 2D Graphics, how would I setup a 'map' or 'level' which contains lets say 12x12 tiles? So if I had a 2x2 map, it would look like: [img]http://i25.tinypic.com/213pvzs.png[/img] Now, having that, how would I setup a system so that each individual tile could be easily modified? That would make it so Tile C would be at coordinates (1, 2). Keep in mind, this wouldnt be your normal coordinate graph from math class. Each tile down would go plus one for the y value, and each tile to the right would go plus one for the x value. Following that last paragraph, I'll give an example. If I wanted to place a 12x12 image on the tile at (1, 2), I would do something like [i]graphics.drawImage("./image.jpg", x, y, null).[/i] The x and y spots is where I get mixed up. Its not that I dont know what that is or how it works, I do. But I dont want to keep specifying those two values by hand. Instead, somewhat of an array[], or multi-array[][] (?), is what I was looking at. But I cant quite think of anything right now. Thanks in advance. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2008, 06:36:17 PM[/size][hr]Well, according to Cheese_Police and lawl on IRC:
[18:26] c|p: Tile[][] map = new Tile[width][height]; [18:26] c|p: ma[i][/i]p[x[i][/i]][y] = new Tile(dicks); [18:27] c|p: or [18:27] c|p: do it da other way [18:27] lawl: ye lul wut i did [18:27] lawl: new tile[w * h] [18:27] c|p: ye [18:27] TeleNubby: ffs [18:27] lawl: w = off / h [18:27] lawl: or some gay shit [18:27] TeleNubby: wtf didnt i think o fthat [18:27] c|p: dats a much better way tbh [18:27] c|p: do it the way lawl is suggesting
I half-get it, half-dont. Can somebody explain a bit more? Also, what are the [][] arrays called exactly?

item.title: Setting up a tile-based map?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

bakatool:

making a x, y plain multi-array in java is waste of memory cuz some of the combinations might not be used since java aint got pointers or jagged arrays? maybe it does dunno i think it’s better to use a object array with each object holding the tile’s important data

Jagged arrays?

int[][] array = new int[4][0]; array[0] = new int[12]; array[1] = new int[2]; array[2] = new int[0]; array[3] = new int[5];
Is possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up a tile-based map?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:34, topic:190382”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=253841.msg2137023#msg2137023 date=1206569753]
You could check a random between 4 numbers specifying whether or not the npc should go a tile north, south, east, or west. And, before it moves the npc to that tile, it checks to see whether or not it is moving outside its walking boundaries, in which case it would re-randomize the numbers again.

As for dialog, all you would do is paint it and draw the string (obviously). I don’t see how that would be very difficult.

The attacking system would just require a properly timed sequence of animations and a randomization of ‘damage’ dealt (again, between a range of numbers).
[/quote]
you live upto your title,
i can tell you came from Moparscape.[/quote]

‘came from’ are the keywords.

[quote=“Ollie, post:39, topic:190382”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=253841.msg2138035#msg2138035 date=1206595093]
Yeah. That’s just about it.
[/quote]
fuck off kid.[/quote]

Moparscapers do have friends. In fact, they have lots of them. I’d rather be a moparscape for a year having fun with friends and probably be successful later in life (since every accusation at the general intelligence at moparscape is always wrong) than a moparisthebest, such as yourself, who is a total asshole toward everyone and who is actually the one with no friends and will probably end up in jail later in life (if they continue on their current route).
